topic.title: Why using DITA?
topic.shortdesc: This section lists benefits of DITA.

ul.li: DITA enforces structured authoring, which results in a good document structure.
DITA facilitates content re-use, which leads to less duplicated content.
DITA supports single sourcing, which speeds up making changes in multiple outputs.
DITA reduces translation costs, because less content has to be translated.
DITA is extendable due to specializations and therefore can easily be adapted to customer needs.
DITA is scalable and can be used by a single author on a single machine or by hundreds of authors in a complex authoring environment with multiple publishing servers.
DITA is effective for collaboration, because DITA files can be shared in version control systems like Git or in a CMS.
DITA enables conditional processing, e.g. based on target audience or product features.
DITA can be converted to all major output formats, e.g. HTML5 or PDF.
DITA seperates content (topics) and context (maps) from presentation, the appearance of documents and webhelps can be quickly by changing global templates.
DITA ensures structural integrity, because it is based on XML which can be validated.
DITA is an open standard (not proprietary) and is not relying on specific tools.
